newsitem.title: LATVIA: Thomson BankWatch upgrades Latvia's rating.
newsitem.headline: Thomson BankWatch upgrades Latvia's rating.

text.p: Thomson BankWatch said on Friday that it had upgraded its rating for the Baltic state of Latvia to BB+ from BB- and hoped to assign a rating this year to Unibanka, the country's second largest bank.
"The new rating reflects positive developments in Latvia's economy," Thomson BankWatch's Walter Pompliano told Reuters by telepohone.
He added that the agency hoped to assign a rating to Unibanka this year.
"We hope to give Unibanka a rating this year to round out our coverage of Latvia's banking sector," he said. "But nothing is set in stone yet."
Thomson earlier said it had assigned an LC-2 short-term local currency rating and a senior debt rating of BB+ to Latvia's largest bank, Parekss Bank.
Thomson has been active in the Baltic region and has assigned ratings to leading banks in Lithuania and Estonia.
